item.title: GE settles over US accounts allegations
item.description: General Electric agreed to pay $50m to settle accounting fraud charges by the US Securities and Exchange Commission

item.title: SEC set to target flash trading
item.description: The US Securities and Exchange Commission is preparing to clamp down on lightning-fast ‘flash’ trades, which are made at lightning speeds made on electronic trading systems amid growing concerns that ontroversy over the practice puts some investors at a disadvantage.

item.title: China’s growth figures fail to add up
item.description: The latest set of first-half gross domestic product numbers provided by China’s provincial authorities are far higher than Beijing’s national figure, raising questions on the accuracy of statistics in the world’s most populous nation

item.title: New cars for old
item.description: Unless US legislators are planning to subsidise the purchase of cars in perpetuity, this ‘cash for clunkers’ scheme will only postpone consolidation and job losses in the auto sector.

item.title: US tax battle weighs on UBS
item.description: Swiss bank UBS posted its third quarterly loss in a row after being hit by restructuring costs

item.title: Sontag to leave Merrill’s ‘thundering herd’
item.description: Dan Sontag is leaving his position as operational head of Merrill Lynch Global Wealth Management in the wake of Sallie Krawcheck’s arrival as his new boss, announced by Bank of America on Monday.

item.title: Threat to ban groups based in havens
item.description: International financial services groups should be ex­cluded from the US market if they are based in countries that are havens from regulation, according to the head of a powerful US congressional committee

item.title: Ditch theory and take away the punchbowl
item.description: John Plender on how central bankers have been unwilling to take pre-emptive action to stop bubbles forming

item.title: Regulatory action may see traders migrate
item.description: Traders, lawyers and bankers worry that US and UK watchdogs risk encouraging regulatory arbitrage should any changes be poorly received

item.title: Wall Street struggles to keep gains
item.description: US stocks saw a mixed session as encouraging housing data helped reverse early losses and keep the benchmark S&P 500 index above the 1,000 level
